intro: Bupleurum intermedium, commonly known as the intermediate valerian, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, featuring slender, branched stems and opposite, lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish-green flowers in umbel-like clusters during the summer months. Its roots are often harvested for medicinal purposes due to their volatile oils and alkaloids. Bupleurum intermedium thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in woodland edges or meadows.
